Subjective: Left ear feels filled with water; little pain; worsens with showering; affects hearing; 3-4/10 pain, 6-7/10 after showering; manageable; no fever; no other symptoms; can't exercise/swim due to pain; recently started swimming; cleans ear with cotton buds 3 times a week; wants pain to stop; scared about ear; Request: Wants to know what's happening with ear; wants pain to go away.
Objective: Vitals: Temperature 36.2; Physical Exam: Right ear clean, eardrum fine; Left ear: red, inflamed, swollen ear canal, can't see eardrum.
Assessment: Left ear canal inflammation, likely due to frequent wetness and cotton bud use.
Plan: • Paracetamol 4000mg/day as needed; • Anti-inflammatory ear drops 3 times a day for 1 week; • Avoid cleaning ear with cotton wool; • Keep ear dry for 1 week; • Follow-up in 1 week.
